Content:
```shell
## git clone this repository
git clone https://github.com/Joyies/TVT.git
cd TVT


# create an environment
conda create -n TVT python=3.10
conda activate TVT
pip install --upgrade pip
pip install -r requirements.txt
```
Translation:
```shell
## git clone this repository
git clone https://github.com/Joyies/TVT.git
cd TVT


# create an environment
conda create -n TVT python=3.10
conda activate TVT
pip install --upgrade pip
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

Content:
## ğŸ‚ Quick Inference

### Real-world Image Super-resolution

#### Step 1: Download the pretrained models
- Download the pretrained SD-2.1-base models from [![weights](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20Hugging%20Face-SD%202.1%20Base-blue)](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/stable-diffusion-2-1-base) 
- Download the model weights ([VAED4](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [TVT model](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [TVTUNet](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [DAPE](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), and [RAM](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)) from [![weights](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20Hugging%20Face-model%20weights-blue)](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main)  and put the model weights in the `ckp/`:

#### Step 2: Prepare testing data and run testing command 
You can modify input_path and output_path to run testing command. The input_path is the path of the test image and the output_path is the path where the output images are saved.

### å®Ÿä¸–ç•Œç”»åƒè¶…è§£åƒ

#### ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—1: äº‹å‰å­¦ç¿’æ¸ˆã¿ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã®ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰
- [![weights](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20Hugging%20Face-SD%202.1%20Base-blue)](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/stable-diffusion-2-1-base) ã‹ã‚‰äº‹å‰å­¦ç¿’æ¸ˆã¿ã®SD-2.1-baseãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã‚’ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã—ã¾ã™ 
- [![weights](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20Hugging%20Face-model%20weights-blue)](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main) ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«é‡ã¿ï¼ˆ[VAED4](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ã€[TVT model](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ã€[TVTUNet](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ã€[DAPE](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ã€ãŠã‚ˆã³ [RAM](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ï¼‰ã‚’ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã—ã€ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«é‡ã¿ã‚’ `ckp/` ã«é…ç½®ã—ã¾ã™:

#### ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—2: ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®æº–å‚™ã¨ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã®å®Ÿè¡Œ
input_path ã¨ output_path ã‚’å¤‰æ›´ã—ã¦ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚input_path ã¯ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆç”»åƒã®ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã§ã€output_path ã¯å‡ºåŠ›ç”»åƒãŒä¿å­˜ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã§ã™ã€‚

RowTranslations.originContent: - Download the pretrained SD-2.1-base models from [![weights](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20Hugging%20Face-SD%202.1%20Base-blue)](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/stable-diffusion-2-1-base)

- Download the model weights ([VAED4](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [TVT model](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [TVTUNet](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [DAPE](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), and [RAM](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)) from [![weights](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20Hugging%20Face-model%20weights-blue)](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main)  and put the model weights in the `ckp/`:
#### Step 2: Prepare testing data and run testing command
You can modify input_path and output_path to run testing command. The input_path is the path of the test image and the output_path is the path where the output images are saved.

Content:
```
python TVT/inferences/inference.py \
--input_image input_path \
--output_dir output_path \
--pretrained_path ckp/model_TVT.pkl \
--pretrained_model_name_or_path stabilityai/stable-diffusion-2-1-base \
--pretrained_unet_path ckp/TVTUNet \
--vae4d_path ckp/vae.ckpt \
--ram_ft_path ckp/DAPE.pth \
--negprompt 'dotted, noise, blur, lowres, smooth' \
--prompt 'clean, high-resolution, 8k' \
--upscale 4 \
--time_step 1
```
Translation:
```
python TVT/inferences/inference.py \
--input_image input_path \
--output_dir output_path \
--pretrained_path ckp/model_TVT.pkl \
--pretrained_model_name_or_path stabilityai/stable-diffusion-2-1-base \
--pretrained_unet_path ckp/TVTUNet \
--vae4d_path ckp/vae.ckpt \
--ram_ft_path ckp/DAPE.pth \
--negprompt 'dotted, noise, blur, lowres, smooth' \
--prompt 'clean, high-resolution, 8k' \
--upscale 4 \
--time_step 1
```

Content: We also provide the tile code to save the GPU memory for inference. You can run the running command and change the tile size and stride according to the VRAM of your device.

RowTranslations.originContent: We also provide the tile code to save the GPU memory for inference. You can run the running command and change the tile size and stride according to the VRAM of your device.

Content:
```
python TVT/inferences/inference_tile.py \
--input_image input_path \
--output_dir output_path \
--pretrained_path ckp/model_TVT.pkl \
--pretrained_model_name_or_path stabilityai/stable-diffusion-2-1-base \
--pretrained_unet_path ckp/TVTUNet \
--vae4d_path ckp/vae.ckpt \
--ram_ft_path ckp/DAPE.pth \
--negprompt 'dotted, noise, blur, lowres, smooth' \
--prompt 'clean, high-resolution, 8k' \
--upscale 4 \
--time_step 1 \
--tiled_size 96 \
--tiled_overlap 32
```
Translation:
```
python TVT/inferences/inference_tile.py \
--input_image input_path \
--output_dir output_path \
--pretrained_path ckp/model_TVT.pkl \
--pretrained_model_name_or_path stabilityai/stable-diffusion-2-1-base \
--pretrained_unet_path ckp/TVTUNet \
--vae4d_path ckp/vae.ckpt \
--ram_ft_path ckp/DAPE.pth \
--negprompt 'dotted, noise, blur, lowres, smooth' \
--prompt 'clean, high-resolution, 8k' \
--upscale 4 \
--time_step 1 \
--tiled_size 96 \
--tiled_overlap 32
```

Content:
## ğŸš„ Training Phase

### Train VAED4 on the OpenImage dataset and LSDIR dataset.
#### Step1: Prepare training data
Download the [OpenImage dataset](https://storage.googleapis.com/openimages/web/index.html) and [LSIDR dataset](https://github.com/ofsoundof/LSDIR). For each image in the LSDIR dataset, crop multiple 512Ã—512 image patches using a sliding window with a stride of 64 pixels;

#### Step2: Train VAED4
The [LDM code](https://github.com/CompVis/latent-diffusion) is used to train VAED4. 


### Train TVTSR on the Real-ISR datasets
#### Step1: Prepare training data

Download the [LSIDR dataset](https://github.com/ofsoundof/LSDIR) and the first 10k [FFHQ dataset](https://github.com/NVlabs/ffhq-dataset). Subsequently, perform data augmentation on the training dataset. Specifically, for each image in the LSDIR dataset, crop multiple 512Ã—512 image patches using a sliding window with a stride of 64 pixels; for the FFHQ dataset, directly resize all images to 512Ã—512.

#### Step2: Train Real-ISR Model

1. Download [VAED4](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [TVTUNet](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), and [RAM](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp) models, and put these models into `ckp/`. 

2. Start training.
Translation:
## ğŸš„ ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ•ã‚§ãƒ¼ã‚º

### OpenImageãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆãŠã‚ˆã³LSDIRãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã§VAED4ã‚’ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ã™ã‚‹ã€‚
#### ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—1: ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®æº–å‚™
[OpenImageãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ](https://storage.googleapis.com/openimages/web/index.html)ãŠã‚ˆã³[LSIDRãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ](https://github.com/ofsoundof/LSDIR)ã‚’ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹ã€‚LSDIRãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆå†…ã®å„ç”»åƒã«å¯¾ã—ã¦ã€ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ‰64ãƒ”ã‚¯ã‚»ãƒ«ã®ã‚¹ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚°ã‚¦ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚¦ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã€è¤‡æ•°ã®512Ã—512ç”»åƒãƒ‘ãƒƒãƒã‚’ã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒ—ã™ã‚‹ï¼›

#### ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—2: VAED4ã®ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°
[ LDMã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰](https://github.com/CompVis/latent-diffusion)ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¦VAED4ã‚’ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ã™ã‚‹ã€‚ 


### Real-ISRãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã§TVTSRã‚’ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ã™ã‚‹
#### ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—1: ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®æº–å‚™

[LSIDRãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ](https://github.com/ofsoundof/LSDIR)ãŠã‚ˆã³æœ€åˆã®1ä¸‡æšã®[FFHQãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ](https://github.com/NVlabs/ffhq-dataset)ã‚’ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹ã€‚ãã®å¾Œã€ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã«å¯¾ã—ã¦ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿æ‹¡å¼µã‚’è¡Œã†ã€‚å…·ä½“çš„ã«ã¯ã€LSDIRãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã®å„ç”»åƒã«å¯¾ã—ã¦ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ‰64ãƒ”ã‚¯ã‚»ãƒ«ã®ã‚¹ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚°ã‚¦ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚¦ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—è¤‡æ•°ã®512Ã—512ç”»åƒãƒ‘ãƒƒãƒã‚’ã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒ—ã—ã€FFHQãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã«å¯¾ã—ã¦ã¯ã™ã¹ã¦ã®ç”»åƒã‚’ç›´æ¥512Ã—512ã«ãƒªã‚µã‚¤ã‚ºã™ã‚‹ã€‚

#### ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—2: Real-ISRãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã®ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°

1. [VAED4](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ã€[TVTUNet](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ã€ãŠã‚ˆã³[RAM](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp)ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã‚’ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã—ã€ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã‚’`ckp/`ã«é…ç½®ã™ã‚‹ã€‚ 

2. ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ã‚’é–‹å§‹ã™ã‚‹ã€‚

RowTranslations.originContent: ### Train VAED4 on the OpenImage dataset and LSDIR dataset.

Download the [OpenImage dataset](https://storage.googleapis.com/openimages/web/index.html) and [LSIDR dataset](https://github.com/ofsoundof/LSDIR). For each image in the LSDIR dataset, crop multiple 512Ã—512 image patches using a sliding window with a stride of 64 pixels;
The [LDM code](https://github.com/CompVis/latent-diffusion) is used to train VAED4.
### Train TVTSR on the Real-ISR datasets

Download the [LSIDR dataset](https://github.com/ofsoundof/LSDIR) and the first 10k [FFHQ dataset](https://github.com/NVlabs/ffhq-dataset). Subsequently, perform data augmentation on the training dataset. Specifically, for each image in the LSDIR dataset, crop multiple 512Ã—512 image patches using a sliding window with a stride of 64 pixels; for the FFHQ dataset, directly resize all images to 512Ã—512.

1. Download [VAED4](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), [TVTUNet](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp), and [RAM](https://huggingface.co/Joypop/TVTSR/tree/main/ckp) models, and put these models into `ckp/`.

Content:
```shell
   accelerate launch --gpu_ids=0,1,2,3, --num_processes=4 TVT/train_TVTSR/train.py \
    --pretrained_model_name_or_path="stabilityai/stable-diffusion-2-1-base" \
    --pretrained_model_name_or_path_vsd="stabilityai/stable-diffusion-2-1-base" \
    --pretrained_unet_path='ckp/TVTUNet' \
    --vae4d_path='ckp/vae.ckpt' \
    --dataset_folder="data_path" \
    --testdataset_folder="test_path" \
    --resolution=512 \
    --learning_rate=5e-5 \
    --train_batch_size=2 \
    --gradient_accumulation_steps=2 \
    --enable_xformers_memory_efficient_attention \
    --eval_freq 500 \
    --checkpointing_steps 500 \
    --mixed_precision='fp16' \
    --report_to "tensorboard" \
    --output_dir="output_path" \
    --lora_rank_unet_vsd=4 \
    --lora_rank_unet=4 \
    --lambda_lpips=2 \
    --lambda_l2=1 \
    --lambda_vsd=1 \
    --lambda_vsd_lora=1 \
    --min_dm_step_ratio=0.25 \
    --max_dm_step_ratio=0.75 \
    --use_vae_encode_lora \
    --align_method="adain" \
    --use_online_deg \
    --deg_file_path="params_TVT.yml" \
    --negative_prompt='painting, oil painting, illustration, drawing, art, sketch, oil painting, cartoon, CG Style, 3D render, unreal engine, blurring, dirty, messy, worst quality, low quality, frames, watermark, signature, jpeg artifacts, deformed, lowres, over-smooth' \
    --test_image_prep='no_resize' \
    --time_step=1 \
    --tracker_project_name "experiment_track_name"
    ```
